title: COX’S BAZAR
description: Cox’s Bazar is home to the world’s longest natural sandy beach, stretching over 120 km along the Bay of Bengal. It is a prime tourist destination in Bangladesh, known for its stunning sunsets, vibrant seafood markets, and nearby attractions like Himchari National Park and Inani Beach.

title: SREEMANGAL
description: Sreemangal, known as the 'Tea Capital of Bangladesh,' is famous for its lush tea gardens, rolling hills, and vibrant wildlife. It is also home to the Lawachara National Park, which hosts rare species like the Hoolock Gibbon and various exotic birds.

title: SUNDARBANS
description: The Sundarbans, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is the largest mangrove forest in the world and home to the Royal Bengal Tiger. This vast delta is a network of rivers, islands, and dense forests, offering thrilling boat safaris and wildlife spotting opportunities.
location: Khulna Division, Bangladesh & West Bengal, India
attractions: Wildlife Safari (Royal Bengal Tiger, Saltwater Crocodiles)

title: SYLHET
description: Sylhet is a picturesque city surrounded by tea gardens, waterfalls, and wetlands. Known for its spiritual significance (home to the shrines of Hazrat Shah Jalal and Shah Paran), it also offers stunning natural beauty with places like Ratargul Swamp Forest and Jaflong.

title: BANDARBAN
description: Bandarban, part of the Chittagong Hill Tracts, is known for its stunning landscapes, indigenous cultures, and trekking trails. Key attractions include Nilgiri Hills, Chimbuk Hill, and the golden temple of Buddha Dhatu Jadi.
